security_audit.summary: This is a declarative SKILL.md training document containing only markdown-based expertise guidance. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or filesystem access beyond configuration. Pure prompt-based skill for training AI on strategic planning methodology.

content.user_title: Plan strategic roadmaps with expert estimation and sprint allocation
content.value_statement: Strategic planning helps teams organize complex initiatives into achievable milestones. This skill provides expert guidance on capacity planning, milestone sizing, and sprint allocation.
actual_capabilities: Break down strategic initiatives into properly-sized milestones using the 5-25 point scale
Estimate team capacity using the 20 points per developer per sprint model
Allocate milestones to sprints and quarters with appropriate buffer calculations
Configure team settings for capacity planning and sprint structure
Track progress at epic, milestone, and sprint levels across the planning hierarchy
limitations: Does not integrate with external project management tools (except via separate ClickUp sync plugin)
Does not handle detailed task breakdown or execution tracking beyond milestone level
Does not automatically generate schedules - requires user input for milestone dates
Does not provide technical specifications or detailed implementation guidance

use_cases.title: Plan quarterly roadmap
use_cases.description: Define strategic epics and allocate them across quarters with proper milestone sizing and team capacity planning

use_cases.title: Break down features
use_cases.description: Transform feature initiatives into properly-sized milestones that fit within sprint capacity constraints

use_cases.title: Allocate sprint work
use_cases.description: Distribute milestones across upcoming sprints while accounting for team availability and buffers

prompt_templates.title: Estimate Milestone
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me size this milestone. It involves implementing user authentication with OAuth integration. How many points should it be and why?

prompt_templates.title: Plan Quarter
prompt_templates.prompt: We have 5 developers and want to plan Q2. Help me define epics and estimate total capacity with a 15 percent buffer for unexpected work.

prompt_templates.title: Allocate Sprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Our team has 20 points capacity this sprint. We have three milestones needing 8, 10, and 12 points. Which should we prioritize and why?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Team Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: We have three teams with different capacities: Team A 3 devs, Team B 4 devs, Team C 2 devs. Help me allocate milestones across teams for this quarter.

output_examples.input: Help me plan a milestone for adding payment processing to our e-commerce platform
output: Suggested milestone structure for payment processing:
‚Ä¢ Milestone 1 (Small, 5-8 pts): Payment provider integration setup and API connection
‚Ä¢ Milestone 2 (Medium, 10-15 pts): Core checkout flow with payment confirmation
‚Ä¢ Milestone 3 (Medium, 10-15 pts): Error handling, retry logic, and payment status updates
‚Ä¢ Milestone 4 (Small, 5-8 pts): Admin dashboard for payment monitoring
Total: 30-46 points spanning 2-3 sprints for a 4-developer team

best_practices: Split milestones over 25 points into smaller units to maintain planning accuracy and sprint focus
Apply a 15 percent buffer for unexpected work when calculating quarterly capacity
Keep milestones coarse enough to avoid duplicating GitHub issues but fine enough to track sprint progress
anti_patterns: Creating milestones that span multiple sprints without intermediate checkpoints
Estimating without considering team availability, holidays, or planned time off
Skipping the collaborative estimation step and sizing milestones alone

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: This skill works with local roadmap files in the .roadmap directory. Separate ClickUp sync plugin enables bidirectional sync with ClickUp.

faq.question: What is the capacity model used?
faq.answer: Standard model is 20 points per developer per 2-week sprint. Points represent about half a day of focused work each.

faq.question: Can I customize sprint length or point values?
faq.answer: Yes. Team configuration via /roadmap-planner:init allows customizing sprint duration and point allocations for your context.

faq.question: Is my planning data stored securely?
faq.answer: All roadmap data stores locally in the .roadmap directory. No data is sent to external services by this skill.

faq.question: Why are my estimates coming in too high or low?
faq.answer: Review milestone size guidelines: Small 5-8 pts, Medium 10-15 pts, Large 18-25 pts. Milestones over 25 points should be split.

faq.question: How does this differ from AI code generation?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on strategic planning what and when, not execution details. It does not write code or create technical specifications.
